content.question: Rumor Monstrum horrendum, ingens, cui quot sunt corpore plumae, tot vigiles oculi subter (mirabile dictu), tot linguae, totidem ora sonant, tot subrigitsubrigo, -ere: raise, prick up aures. Nocte volat caeli medio terraeque per umbram stridensstrido, stidere: howl, shriek nec dulci declinat lumina somno. Aeneid 4.181-185 Translate the passage above as literally as possible.

frqParts.text: Rumor Monstrum horrendum, ingens, cui quot sunt corpore plumae, tot vigiles oculi subter (mirabile dictu), tot linguae, totidem ora sonant, tot subrigitsubrigo, -ere: raise, prick up aures. Nocte volat caeli medio terraeque per umbram stridensstrido, stidere: howl, shriek nec dulci declinat lumina somno. Aeneid 4.181-185 Translate the passage above as literally as possible.

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12
